alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge; South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 11:21AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...STRONG WEST WINDS EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... Strong low pressure area will approach the region later tonight, bringing breezy southerly winds. But, as the low moves east of the Cascades Friday morning, winds will turn westerly and increase. West winds of 25 to 40 mph are expected over the higher terrain of the Cascades, as well as through the Columbia River Gorge. Peak gusts will vary depending on terrain and canyons, but overall, gusts of 45 to 60 mph are likely. With these winds, there is the potential for tree damage. Spotty power outage are possible as well.

area.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; South Washington Cascades
